solution_line_template: There were an average of {morning_apples} + {afternoon_apples} = <<{morning_apples}+{afternoon_apples}={total_apples}>>{total_apples} apples.
Thus, Wendy gained {total_apples} x ${apple_price} = $<<{total_apples}*{apple_price}={sales_apples}>>{sales_apples} for selling apples.
And, she gained an additional {total_oranges} x ${orange_price} = $<<{total_oranges}*{orange_price}={sales_oranges}>>{sales_oranges} for selling oranges.
Therefore, her total sales for the day is ${sales_apples} + {sales_oranges} = $<<{sales_apples}+{sales_oranges}={total_sales}>>{total_sales}.
